Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink, very worn in parts, containing part of a letter.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.103)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87614) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87614)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 116 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
